Overview

LMI is seeking a motivated Power Platform Automation & App Development Intern to support business and IT teams by designing and delivering low-code solutions that streamline processes and improve efficiency. This internship provides hands-on experience building real-world applications and automated workflows using Microsoft Power Platform technologies, while working closely with stakeholders across the organization.

LMI is a new breed of digital solutions provider dedicated to accelerating government impact with innovation and speed. Investing in technology and prototypes ahead of need, LMI brings commercial-grade platforms and mission-ready AI to federal agencies at commercial speed.

 

Leveraging our mission-ready technology and solutions, proven expertise in federal deployment, and strategic relationships, we enhance outcomes for the government, efficiently and effectively. With a focus on agility and collaboration, LMI serves the defense, space, healthcare, and energy sectors—helping agencies navigate complexity and outpace change. Headquartered in Tysons, Virginia, LMI is committed to delivering impactful results that strengthen missions and drive lasting value.

Responsibilities

The intern will focus primarily on process automation and application development, including:

  • Design, build, and maintain automated workflows using Power Automate
  • Develop and enhance low-code applications using Power Apps (primarily canvas apps)
  • Translate business and operational requirements into scalable automation and app solutions
  • Integrate Power Platform solutions with Microsoft 365 services (SharePoint, Teams, Outlook, Excel, Dataverse)
  • Test, troubleshoot, and optimize workflows and applications for performance and reliability
  • Document solutions, workflows, and Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs)
  • Support governance, security, and best practices within the Power Platform environment
  • Participate in sprint planning, project meetings, and/or solution reviews

Qualifications

  • Currently enrolled in a Bachelor’s or Master’s degree program in Computer Science, Information Systems, Software Engineering, or a related technical field
  • Available to work 10–12 weeks beginning June 2026
  • Authorized to work in the United States for any employer
  • Hands-on experience with Power Automate and/or Power Apps through coursework, projects, or internships
  • Familiarity with Microsoft 365 services and common data sources
  • Strong analytical, problem-solving, and logical thinking skills
  • Strong written and verbal communication skills
  • Ability to work independently and manage multiple tasks in a deadline-driven environment

Additional Desired Qualifications

  • Experience building canvas Power Apps with user-friendly interfaces
  • Experience creating automated workflows that integrate multiple systems
  • Basic understanding of connectors, triggers, approvals, and error handling in Power Automate
  • Familiarity with Dataverse and environment management concepts
  • Exposure to Power BI or data visualization concepts (nice to have)
  • Interest in low-code/no-code development and process improvement initiatives

Other Information

  • All intern positions at LMI are paid positions.
